Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a zero-based value that specifies the order in which the argument is evaluated.
Docs.value: A zero-based value that specifies the order in which the argument is evaluated.

remarks.format: ## Remarks By default, the evaluation order of the argument is unspecified and is equal to the <xref:System.Activities.Argument.UnspecifiedEvaluationOrder> value. Set <xref:System.Activities.Argument.EvaluationOrder%2A> to a value greater or equal to zero to specify an evaluation order for this argument. Windows Workflow Foundation evaluates arguments with a specified evaluation order in ascending order. Note that arguments with an unspecified evaluation order are evaluated before those with a specified evaluation order.

Docs.exception: The value is less than zero and not equal to .
